file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 25-60-01-06 - FIRST AID KIT&MEDICAL KIT - INSPECTION/CHECK

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL FIRST AID KIT&MEDICAL KIT - INSPECTION/CHECK EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 1. General A. This section gives the procedures for the inspection/check of the first-aid kit and medical kit. B. The first-aid kit and medical kit are installed on the LH wardrobe, RH wardrobe, outboard galley, forward galley or aft galley, as applicable. C. On the aircraft equipped with 16 seat, the first-aid kit and medical kit are installed on the LH Forward Stowage. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ACFT MODEL(S) FIRST-AID KIT AND MEDICAL KIT - IN- 25-60-01-200-801-A ♦ EMB-135 SPECTION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General CONFIG-2 25-60-01 Page 1 of 5 Rev 52 - Apr 28/17 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 25-60-01-200-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ACFT MODEL(S) EMB-135 2. FIRST-AID KIT AND MEDICAL KIT - INSPECTION A. General (1) The function of this inspection is to make sure that the condition of the first-aid kit and medical kit is good and that their permitted life is not expired. B. Zones and Accesses Not Applicable C. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials Not Applicable F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task On the wardrobe shelf H. Inspect (General Visual) First-Aid Kit and Medical Kit for Condition and Validation SUBTASK 212-005-B (1) Remove the first-aid kit and medical kit from the LH wardrobe, RH wardrobe, outboard galley, forward galley or aft galley, as applicable (Figure 601). (2) For aircraft equipped with 16 seats, remove the first-aid kit and medical kit from the LH forward stowage (Figure 602). (3) Do the inspection of the first-aid kit as follows: (a) Inspect the first-aid kit for violation and expiration date of the packaging of all the items of the kit. NOTE: The items with the packaging violated must be replaced. (4) Do the inspection of the medical kit as follows: (a) Examine the medical kit to make sure that its permitted life is not expired and that the tell-tale wire is not broken. NOTE: If the permitted life is expired or the tell-tale wire is broken, make sure that you can find all items in the kit and examine the date which shows the permitted life of each of them. Include or replace items, as applicable. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 CONFIG-2 25-60-01 Page 2 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (5) Put the first-aid kit and medical kit back on the LH wardrobe, RH wardrobe, outboard galley, forward galley or aft galley, as applicable (Figure 601). (6) For aircraft equipped with 16 seats, put the first-aid kit and medical kit back on the LH forward stowage (Figure 602). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 200-801-A/600 CONFIG-2 25-60-01 Page 3 of 5 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
